data.question: What is the main strategy introduced for creating hierarchical bi-porous features in MOFs?
What is the pore size of the octahedral cages used as UBUs in SNNU-45?
What is the C2H2 uptake capacity of SNNU-45 at 1 atm and 273 K?
What is the C2H2/CO2 selectivity of SNNU-45 at 298 K?
What is the main reason for the ultrahigh C2H2/CO2 selectivity in SNNU-45 according to the text?
What is the C2H2 uptake capacity of SNNU-45 at 298 K?
What is the main contribution of the packing pores in SNNU-45?
How does the UBU strategy affect the gas separation performance of SNNU-45?
data.answer: It enhances both the gas uptake capacity and separation performance.

data.question: Why does SNNU-45 have a high C2H2 uptake capacity?
data.answer: Due to the alignment of open Co sites in the UBU space and uncoordinated carboxylate O donor sites.

data.question: What role do the Lewis basic sites play in SNNU-45's performance?
data.answer: They provide strong binding affinity toward C2H2 through hydrogen bonding.

data.question: Why is SNNU-45 considered a good candidate for C2H2 storage?
data.answer: Because of its remarkably high uptake capacity at 273 K.

data.question: How does the size of the UBU pores in SNNU-45 contribute to its selectivity for C2H2 over CO2?
data.answer: The UBU pores are perfectly sized to capture C2H2 molecules but too short for CO2 molecules.

data.question: What demonstrates the recyclability of SNNU-45 for C2H2 adsorption?
data.answer: No loss of C2H2 adsorption capacity even after five cycles.

data.question: Is the C2H2 uptake capacity of SNNU-45 at 298 K higher than most renowned MOFs?
Does SNNU-45 exhibit a higher C2H2/CO2 selectivity at 298 K compared to benchmark materials like HOF-3a?
Is the C2H2 adsorption capacity of SNNU-45 at 273 K lower than NJU-Bai17 and ZJU-5?
Can SNNU-45 achieve high C2H2 uptake as well as top-level separation efficiency between C2H2 and CO2?
Is the breakthrough time of SNNU-45 for C2H2/CO2 mixtures at room temperature and 1 atm among the top-performing MOFs?
Does the UBU strategy only improve the C2H2 storage capacity without affecting the separation performance?
Are the packing pores in SNNU-45 responsible for its high C2H2/CO2 selectivity?
